items.title: Homes lost and towns on edge as major fires burn across Victoria
items.description: Authorities say the Longwood fire in central Victoria and fires in the Otways in the state's south-west are of greatest concern to firefighters as blazes continue to burn across the state.

items.title: Tropical Cyclone Koji expected to make landfall within hours
items.description: Tropical Cyclone Koji is expected to make landfall within hours between Ayr and Mackay, according to the weather bureau.

items.title: Track Tropical Cyclone Koji live as it approaches Australia's coastline
items.description: Track the path of Tropical Cyclone Koji and monitor wind speeds as the system moves towards the coast.

items.title: 'Only thing missing is my eight-year-old daughter': Father's chilling report
items.description: Fifty years after Beaumaris schoolgirl Eloise Worledge vanished, could new leads solve one of Australia's most haunting cold cases?

items.title: Has Trump landed a dud with his Venezuelan oil play?
items.description: While debate rages over the legality and the potential fallout from America's incursion, there's been a quiet acceptance that it is all about oil.

items.title: The rhetoric of the Trump administration has taken a chilling turn
items.description: There have been plenty of examples of the Trump administration's contempt for legalities, diplomacy and alliances, but this week Trump and his lieutenants went further.

items.title: Trump says oil executives will have 'total safety' if they invest in Venezuela
items.description: The US president has pivoted to portraying capturing former Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro as as a new-found economic opportunity for the US, seizing tankers carrying Venezuelan oil.

items.title: Secretive Christian sect uses trusts to obscure wealth, survivors say
items.description: Survivors of a secretive Christian sect, under investigation by the FBI, say it is hiding wealth through trusts, blocking access to abuse compensation.

items.title: New video emerges of ICE agent shooting woman in Minneapolis
items.description: The new footage, reposted by the White House on social media, was recorded by the agent involved, and reveals the confrontation that led to the shooting as well as him swearing at her immediately afterwards.

items.title: Ukrainian underdog sets up Sabalenka final with 55-minute annihilation
items.description: Marta Kostyuk crushed world number six Jessica Pegula in less than an hour after Aryna Sabalenka powered past Karolína Muchová to reach a third consecutive Brisbane International final.

items.title: Khawaja stars as Heat thrash Thunder, Warner injured
items.description: Usman Khawaja's international career may be over, but he showed he is far from a spent force by stroking a fine 78 to help the Brisbane Heat to a BBL victory.

items.title: Former Adelaide Festival leaders label Palestinian author's exclusion 'grave mistake'
items.description: Nearly a dozen former leaders of the Adelaide Festival are calling for Randa Abdel-Fattah to be reinvited to Writers' Week, adding to a mounting crisis over the Palestinian-Australian author's exclusion from the literary festival.

items.title: 'Predator-free' fence project praised for restoring Kangaroo Island's native wildlife
items.description: Five years after feral cats were removed from inside the Western River Refuge on Kangaroo Island, populations of endangered species have boomed.

items.title: 'Rich have become poor': Venezuelans describe their daily struggle
items.description: The ABC hears from residents of Venezuela's capital, Caracas, about the struggles of daily life and their hopes and fears after American intervention.

items.title: Aussies on top of moguls World Cup standings as Olympics loom
items.description: Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham both move to the top of the overall FIS Moguls World Cup standings with success at Val Saint-Côme.

items.title: Mums who drank during pregnancy call for universal alcohol warnings
items.description: New research shows thousands of alcohol products remain on Australian shelves without mandated pregnancy warning labels.

items.title: 1986 in music: The big albums turning 40 this year
items.description: Pop and MTV ruled supreme but 1986 was also a banner year for hip hop and metal.

items.title: 'Terrible job to cuddle baby wombats': Behind the scenes as a wildlife carer
items.description: There are about 40-50 active volunteer carers within ACT Wildlife, but the organisation says more are needed, especially as the temperature soars.

items.title: Australia to discuss critical minerals with G7 in Washington next week
items.description: India was also invited to attend the meeting, but it is unclear if it has accepted the invitation.

items.title: A Tasmanian council built a wall. It hasn't gone down well
items.description: A concrete wall built on the picturesque waterfront of a small Tasmanian town has prompted confusion and concern from residents.

items.title: The Korean Wave may splash back into China amid thawing ties
items.description: China has restricted access to South Korean pop culture since 2016, when Seoul received US anti-missile technology. Warmer bilateral ties are spurring optimism that will change.

items.title: Elon Musk limits X's AI image generator over non-consensual sexual imagery
items.description: For more than a week, X's AI bot Grok has been generating sexual images of women and children at the request of other users, even when they ask it not to.

items.title: Greta Beach should be pristine. Instead, it's choking on a tsunami of plastic waste
items.description: A beach on a remote island, and home to nesting turtles, is annually overwhelmed by tonnes of plastic garbage. Christmas Island is doing what it can to help stem the never-ending tide of pollution.

items.title: PFAS to perfection: The story behind regional NT town's 'designer' water
items.description: The tap water in the Northern Territory town of Katherine — which includes a "designer" mix of river water from the world-famous Nitmiluk National Park and mineral-rich groundwater — has been named Australia's best drop.

items.title: 'Chain of errors' contributed to woman's death after routine surgery: coroner
items.description: The Northern Territory coroner has determined a series of human errors contributed to the 2022 death of an Indigenous woman at Royal Darwin Hospital, in the weeks after she sought a routine surgery.
